body: You ran `which python` outside of your conda environment; activate it first, and the command will correctly point to python 3.7.10. You do not need pythonw though, `python` or `ipython` alone is fine on Mac. Note that if you want to run a headless version of deeplabcut, the DLC-CPU-LITE environment is probably what you'll want ðŸ˜Š

Thanks for the very quick reply! Unfortunately using the DLC-CPU-LITE environment does not solve the issue.

I also checked and, in the conda environment, pythonw points to a different path than python, see the terminal output below. I find suspicious that pythonw does not point to the anaconda environment.

***Terminal output with python:***

>(base) stal-lt04:~ sbaudouin$ conda activate DLC-CPU
>(DLC-CPU) stal-lt04:~ sbaudouin$ which pythonw
>/usr/bin/pythonw
>(DLC-CPU) stal-lt04:~ sbaudouin$ which python
>/Users/sbaudouin/opt/anaconda3/envs/DLC-CPU/bin/python
>(DLC-CPU) stal-lt04:~ sbaudouin$ conda deactivate

I also check in the DLC-CPU-LITE environment and it is the same:

***Terminal output with python:***
>(base) stal-lt04:~ sbaudouin$ conda activate DLC-CPU-LITE
>(DLC-CPU-LITE) stal-lt04:~ sbaudouin$ which pythonw
>/usr/bin/pythonw
>(DLC-CPU-LITE) stal-lt04:~ sbaudouin$ which python
>/Users/sbaudouin/opt/anaconda3/envs/DLC-CPU-LITE/bin/python

If I try to load the GUI with pythonw the error message is:
>(DLC-CPU) stal-lt04:~ sbaudouin$ pythonw -m deeplabcut
>/System/Library/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/2.7/Resources/Python.app/Contents/MacOS/Python: No >module named deeplabcut

If I try to run it with python the error message is (I know python should not be used when working with Mac but I still gave it a try):
>(DLC-CPU) stal-lt04:~ sbaudouin$ python -m deeplabcut
>Starting GUI...
>This program needs access to the screen. Please run with a
>Framework build of python, and only when you are logged in
>on the main display of your Mac.

Doing the same with DLC-CPU-LITE gives the exact same result. So I am a bit stuck

There are several things you could try:
- deactivate then reactivate the environment
- try with pythonw3
- run `hash -r` to reset the cache

Thanks Jeylau for the feedback, unfortunately it keeps on not working. 

I activated/deactivated and also uninstalled/installed everything but nothing worked. 

I tried to run the test of the installation: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=IOWtKn3l33s.
It worked with python for the import of DLC but it blocks at the same stage with the following error message:
>This program needs access to the screen. Please run with a
>Framework build of python, and only when you are logged in
>on the main display of your Mac.

With pythonw I also have the same message error as before:
>(DLC-CPU) stal-lt04:examples sbaudouin$ pythonw testscript.py
>Traceback (most recent call last):
> File "testscript.py", line 16, in <module>
>    import deeplabcut
>ImportError: No module named deeplabcut

Pythonw3 does not work for me, here is the output:
>(DLC-CPU) stal-lt04:examples sbaudouin$ pythonw3 testscript.py
>-bash: pythonw3: command not found

I did try hash -r several time in and out of the conda environment but it does not change anything.

I found a description of a similar problem in a stackoverflow: https://stackoverflow.com/questions/64589937/mac-pythonw-gui-on-catalina-os-anaconda-not-working-python3.

It does look very similar to my issue but I am a bit lost when it comes to implement the solution. I do not exactly how to implement the solution and at what stage. Do you think it is a potential solution? If so would you be able to provide a bit more guidance on how to implement the solution?

Thanks anyway for the support, I greatly appreciate.

I think I solved it, at least I have the GUI!

The way I solved it was the following: 
In short, use command
`conda install python.app`
in the DLC-CPU environment. 

To confirm it did the work I then use command `which pythonw` in the DLC-CPU environment. 
I got the expect terminal output:
>(DLC-CPU) stal-lt04:~ sbaudouin$ which pythonw
>/Users/sbaudouin/opt/anaconda3/envs/DLC-CPU/bin/pythonw

Note that I tried to run the test of the installation described in the youtube video but it failed. I do not know if I should be concerned.
But now I have the GUI and it looks promising.

@baudyboy I just wanted to thank you for starting this thread and for the solution you offered in your last post: I was having the exact same issue with getting DLC to work on my Mac and spent days trying to circumvent this problem. Like you, I wasn't able to get testscript.py to complete its running, but I'm happy to at least be able to access the GUI at this point and start testing it with my data. My thanks again, and good luck with whatever you may be using DLC for!

I can confirm this issue and the fix (also seen in the forums).
Even with a fully updated conda base, creating a new env on mac with the DLC-CPU.yaml no longer installs a new pythonw into the env. However, after creating the env:

1. activate the env with `conda activate DLC-CPU`
2. install pythonw with `conda install python.app`

Allows DLC to run. It might be necessary to add either `python.app` to the config file, or add a note to the installation docs.

issue.title: Pythonw using an old version (2.7)

repository.name: DeepLabCut
repository.description: Official implementation of DeepLabCut: Markerless pose estimation of user-defined features with deep learning for all animals incl. humans

license.name: GNU Lesser General Public License v3.0

issue.body:
**Your Operating system and DeepLabCut version**

Laptop: MacBook Air early 2015
OS: MacOS Big Sur
DeepLabCut Version: 2.2rc2

**Describe the problem**
    
Downloaded annaconda. We used the DLC.CPU.yaml file (downloaded off website).
We ran "conda env create -f DLC-CPU" this created the environment and downloaded deeplabcut successfully.
We activated this with "conda activate DLC-CPU". Then we tried to use "pythonw -m deeplabcut". An error message with "no module called deeplabcut". We tried "pythonw", but our python is using an older version of pythonw and "import deeplabcut" is not working.

Error message:
WARNING: Python 2.7 is not recommended. 
This version is included in macOS for compatibility with legacy software. 
Future versions of macOS will not include Python 2.7. 
Instead, it is recommended that you transition to using 'python3' from within Terminal.

Python 2.7.16 (default, May  8 2021, 11:48:02) 
[GCC Apple LLVM 12.0.5 (clang-1205.0.19.59.6) [+internal-os, ptrauth-isa=deploy on darwin
Type "help", "copyright", "credits" or "license" for more information.
>>>  

We have noticed DLC is not compatible with older versions of python. Is this the issue? We have tried to update both python and pythonw (checked this with "which python", unistalled and installed DLC-CPU again) and the newer version (pythonw 3.0.3) was working outside of the environment. However, once DLC-CPU is activated python reverts to the older version. Thank you in advance for your help!

Please place code inside this:

Last login: Fri Jun  4 14:22:59 on ttys000
(base) Vivi@Violas-Air ~ % conda activate DLC-CPU
(DLC-CPU) Vivi@Violas-Air ~ % pythonw -m deeplabcut
/System/Library/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/2.7/Resources/Python.app/Contents/MacOS/Python: No module named deeplabcut
(DLC-CPU) Vivi@Violas-Air ~ % 


Last login: Fri Jun  4 14:45:34 on ttys000
(base) Vivi@Violas-Air ~ % conda activate DLC-CPU
(DLC-CPU) Vivi@Violas-Air ~ % pythonw

WARNING: Python 2.7 is not recommended. 
This version is included in macOS for compatibility with legacy software. 
Future versions of macOS will not include Python 2.7. 
Instead, it is recommended that you transition to using 'python3' from within Terminal.

Python 2.7.16 (default, May  8 2021, 11:48:02) 
[GCC Apple LLVM 12.0.5 (clang-1205.0.19.59.6) [+internal-os, ptrauth-isa=deploy on darwin
Type "help", "copyright", "credits" or "license" for more information.
>>> import deeplabcut
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "<stdin>", line 1, in <module>
ImportError: No module named deeplabcut
>>>

issue.body:
OS: Windows 10
DeepLabCut Version: 2.1.10.4
Anaconda env used: Yes

**Describe the problem**

Hi, I am new to DeepLabCut and while I was running the testscript.py file to check my installation, I ran into this problem
TypeError: analyze_videos() got an unexpected keyword argument 'allow_growth'
I followed the tutorial video step-by-step and I am not sure how to fix this. Any advice or help is much appreciated. Thanks!

**How to Reproduce the problem**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1.  open Anaconda Prompt
2.  Activate DLC-CPU
3.  run python testscript.py

issue.title: GUI not starting - macOS

repository.name: DeepLabCut
repository.description: Official implementation of DeepLabCut: Markerless pose estimation of user-defined features with deep learning for all animals incl. humans

license.name: GNU Lesser General Public License v3.0

issue.body:
### Is there an existing issue for this?

- [X] I have searched the existing issues

### Bug description

After typing "pythonw -m deeplabcut" I am receiving an error. "You installed DLC lite, thus GUI's cannot be used. If you need GUI support please: pip install 'deeplabcut[gui]''. After installing that pip the same issue appears. How can I get the GUI to start?

### Operating System

operating system MacOS Big Sur

### DeepLabCut version

dlc version

### DeepLabCut mode

single animal

### Device type

CPU

### Steps To Reproduce

_No response_

### Relevant log output

```shell
"You installed DLC lite, thus GUI's cannot be used. If you need GUI support please: pip install 'deeplabcut[gui]''.

File ~/opt/anaconda3/envs/DEEPLABCUT/lib/python3.8/site-packages/wx/core.py:2102, in App.__init__(self, redirect, filename, useBestVisual, clearSigInt)
   2099         msg = "Unable to create GUI"
   2100         # TODO: more description is needed for wxMSW...
-> 2102     raise SystemExit(msg)
   2104 # This has to be done before OnInit
   2105 self.SetUseBestVisual(useBestVisual)
```


### Anything else?

_No response_
